website_summaries.verdict: The Moto 360 Sport offers no compelling justification for you to buy it versus one of the many competing dedicated smart running watches.
pros: The Moto 360 Sport has GPS for tracking pace and distance when running, and a display that is easy to read in different environments
cons: expensive compared to similar GPS watches
Android Wear still feels like a work in progress

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife because she has a Moto phone and I thought they would work well together. Every time she got into her car, which has a built in blue tooth system, the watch would unpair and then fail to re-pair with her phone when she got out, forcing her to manually re-pair them. Then one evening it got hot enough to burn a ring on her wrist and stopped working.

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 months now. Overall I am happy with it. I don't think that a smart watch is a must have item or game changer but for what I paid I'm not disappointed. Would probably not be happy if I paid $200+ for one. I am a bit worried about how long the band will last since you can not replace it. I read a lot of reviews about lint being an issue but o have not had a problem at all with the white version. If you're a runner this is a great purchase. If you're not, your phone does everything this does only better.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Until It Stops Working
customer_reviews.text: I was actually happy with this watch other than the battery life. Now out of the blue, it just won't charge anymore, and there's literally nothing I can do about it. I'm not going to get into a cycle of having to replace a $300 watch every year or two the same way smartphones now crap out after a couple of years, so I replaced it with an $80 Amazfit Bip and am completely content and actually pleasantly surprised at how little I miss the much more expensive watch with more "features". I'll check out new Wear OS watches once they start building them with the new Snapdragon chip, but for now, the hardware experiences aren't worth the $$.

customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth connection with earphones (no cellphone mode) is weak, if used in left arm you`ll experience a lot of interference and sound cuts, so I`ve been forced to use it in my right arm to minimize this problem.

customer_reviews.title: Great Android Wear experience that is lighter and smaller than ...

customer_reviews.title: Missed opportunities.
customer_reviews.text: Missing out on 2 important part of the Android wear experience, which is the versatility of the replaceable watch band, and speaker. Having the replaceable band option can create an infinite combination of watch face and band combo, which effectively create an infinite amount of watches. Not having a speaker missed out on turning watch into a speaker phone, and you can not watch videos. I'm a gym rat but not a runner. so the GPS option is nice, but not necessary for me.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Complete GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: Great while it works. GPS was accurate enough and I loved being able to track my run and listen to music while leaving my phone at home. BUT.... It Broke after 2 months as it wen't into a constant boot loop. UPDATE - After Broken watch was replaced, the replacement ALSO Broke, which was then replaced by another broken 360, which was then also replaced by a 3rd broken 360 sport! I just opened my 4th replacement for this issue and the screen was completely shot, AGAIN! BROKEN! Motorolla continues to ship broken refurbs, it's as if they don't even test them. DO NOT BUY these things are complete garbage.

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs. Wish battery life was better
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to increase my workout performance. No longer need to carry my phone around while I'm working out and the timer has been great. Android gear compatibility is great, no problem uploading my custom watch face, "Dallas Cowboys". Battery life definitely sucks though, lucky to last 24 hours. If I'm working a dbl at work I can pretty much count on it being dead by the time I return home the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G. Whitesell

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE WITH IPHONE
customer_reviews.text: A very good watch however, the functionality is significantly reduced while using with my iphone 5c so went and purchased a S7 will update when received.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about buying this watch because of the reviews saying it won't last the day. But I use it the whole day and I take it for an afternoon run with the GPS on. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is not perfect but at the top of the heap for Android ...
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised the reviews are not higher than they are. It is not perfect but at the top of the heap for Android wear. I am an original moto 360 owner and find the sport to be better in many ways. It fits better. Looks speaker and more like a normal watch. Has good features for running, walking, and hiking. The gps works great if you let it set up before taking off, about 30 seconds or less. The screen works good outdoors. As an original moto 360 owner the battery is even a big improvement. Count me as impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Weidner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Outdated and no longer supported but still a good watch if you find it for an amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: The size is nice. It's not so big that it looks like a divers watch. Most time I still have charge at the end of the day. The display is easily readable in full sunlight. Motorola gave up on smartwatches so they'll be no more updates. Even though I still like the watch I don't recommend buying one unless you find an amazing deal. It's outdated, is no longer supported and the manufacturer pulled out of the market.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.text: It has all the functions I need. Connects very well with the phone and is really easy to use. The stripe is comfortable but a bit dirty because of the material.

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto 360 Sport - 45mm, White
product_meta.description: Meet your new workout partner. Get everything you need for your run—without the need for your phone. Track your performance with built-in GPS and stay fit with an incredibly accurate heart rate monitor. After your workout, read your Gmail, check the latest traffic, and receive Facebook updates, all thanks to the power of Android Wear. Moto 360 Sport. Choose the watch that’s in step with you.
feature_bullets: All healthy relationships need space. Including the one with your phone. That’s why there’s the new Moto 360. It streamlines your mobile life by delivering the information that matters to you, giving you more time to do the things you love. With designs made specifically for men or women, it’s easy to find the color, size, and style that fits you best. Because you deserve choice when it comes to what you wear on your wrist.
Updates, not interruptions: Stay connected and up to date by getting messages, news, weather, and more without constantly having to check your phone.
Men’s and women’s collections: Choose from modern designs made specifically for men or women, each one precision-crafted and built to last.
Classic round design: With edge-to-edge glass and an exceptionally thin bezel, you see more all the way around.

Quick-release bands for Moto 360 (2nd Gen) are designed to be swapped in seconds. Android Wear requires a phone running Android 4.3+ or iOS 9+. Android Wear for iOS is available for iPhone 5 and later.
Moto Body fitness tracker: Keep fit by tracking your steps, calories, and heart rate right from your wrist.
